title: Anyone Heard of Darwinia?
content:
I've been meaning to post this for about a year now, but anyway...

Has anyone here heard of [url=http://www.darwinia.co.uk/]Darwinia[/url]?

It's a unique game that combines hundreds of different classic games in a unique, fun and suprisingly deep game.

The other thing that makes it cool is that the developers, [url=http://www.introversion.co.uk/]Introversion Software[/url], is a company made of four people.

It is an amazing game, and I strongly recommend it, as well as Introversion's other game, [url=http://www.uplink.co.uk/]Uplink[/url]. And I am waiting for [url=http://www.introversion.co.uk/defcon/]Defcon[/url], checking the website ever 5 minutes for more news.

title: Duh... Win, yah?
content:
I think I recall reading about it on Underdogs or something. Seemed interesting, but I never got to trying it out. Must do so sometime, along with Uplink. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Duh... Win, yah?
content: I strongly suggest you do - it's an insanely trippy and original RTS experience. You can download the demo from the site linked above.

title: Re: Duh... Win, yah?
content: I've played Uplink, it's great fun.Wombat is my little donation to all the crazy people who do stuff with old games.  [url=http://www.szevvy.com]www.szevvy.com[/url]

title: Re: Duh... Win, yah?
content: Hey, these looks interesting.. Perhaps I'll need to try! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Duh... Win, yah?
content: Played it, yeah.  Nice graphics.  Reminded me of Tron, to be honest.

title: Re: Duh... Win, yah?
content:
I think this is in the Source software list, which would help its popularity.
I haven't played it (yet), but the video I saw about it looked interesting.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Duh... Win, yah?
content:
You go to www.darwinia.co.uk and you can download the demo for free. You need a good graphics card (to be honest my current graphics card won't play anything except Commander Keen and BioMenace), with 3d Acceleration/Hardware Support. It's worth playing, and there's that little kick of optimism you get when you see your little darwinians fighting back against the Viruses.

Or you can just form squads and fire huge lasers and rockets at them, but that's not as fun as seeing little green men with tiny lasers shooting long Snake-like red things.
